item.title: Kubecon EU 2016
item.author: vincent.drl@gmail.com (Vincent De Smet)
item.description:
Trying to summarize the twitter streams & @kubeconio so you don’t have to…

First, see the updated docs to if you’re still wondering what Kubernetes is.

Then, refer to the summary blog posts from people that were actually at KubeCon:

  • corekube.com Day 1 Summary
  • livewyer.com/ Day 1 Summary

& Summaries after the Conference finished:

  • corekube.com Day 2 Summary
  • Insights from Kubernetes
  • TL/DR: KubeCon
  • QAware Kubecon Recap

What I pieced together from the Twitter Stream:

Day 1

  • Kubernetes 1.2 available by end of March 2016

  • ReplicaSets - ReplicaSets support a more generic selector compared to Replication Controllers - explanation of difference

  • Deployments manage ReplicaSets based on a template. Updating the template will make deployments act based on the difference of Desired vs Actual state, i.e. version updates will result in a rolling update (w/ zero downtime)

  • Config Maps - late-binding, live-updated and atomic. Take the pod configuration out of the pod and let the kubelet provision it (either as env vars or config files mounted into the pod). Secrets were used to late bind config, Config Maps are designed as a better solution for this requirement. (see also: Kubernetes/Issues/12732 - Keys/Certs generation for services)

  • DaemonSet (i.e. cluster-wide node agents for logging / networking / storage / … )

  • Kubernetes Dashboard Questionnaire

  • Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF): Linux Foundation Collaborative project aiming to advance a common set of open source tech to accelerate adoption of microservices, containers and cloud native applications. CNCF Accepts k8s as First Hosted Project - 1 goal is to establish a 1000-node cluster for the CNCF community to run and validate Cloud Native applications and infrastructure at scale.

  • CoreOS: rkt-first approach - New kubelet-wrapper - 80% feature parity - estimated for end of 2016Q1 - Slides? by @joshixisjosh9 - Appc Builder: dgr

  • Used by a lot of KubeCon demos: Weave Scope provides a visual map of your Docker containers, so you can intuitively understand, monitor, and control your applications. Scope comes with built-in Kubernetes support. Use Scope to visualize Calico

  • New Docs website - Contributing, fixing issues, collecting bounties repo - $10k dollars allotted for bug fixes…

  • Kubernetes and the Potential for Higher Level Interfaces - slides by @garethr

  • Cloud-Native SDN for Kubernetes - slides - Romana: CNI plugin for k8s. With Romana you won’t have the overhead of a virtual network overlay so your Nodes will communicate more directly without tunnels or encapsulation - Video from demo at Meetup. See also Running k8s with Romana & Slides from Meetup.

  • SDN - See also: Scalable networking with Calico

  • SDN - See also: Open Contrail on pannel discussion - ref: k8s & OpenSTack

  • The State of State - no slides :( - tweeted summary slide?

persistent volumes providing cluster-wide non-ephemeral storage. A couple of different cluster storage providers are available for persistent volumes in k8s: More classic ones like NFS and SCSI; cloud native ones like GlusterFS and Ceph; cloud provider specific ones for GCE and AWS and storage abstraction layers like Flocker.

  • Extending Services & Ingress with nginx - in contrib

  • Kubernetes Volume plugins - slides by @agonzalezro

  • Kubernetes meets twitter/finagle for Resilient Microservices see: linkerd - slides by @olix0r

  • If you can drink and watch Star Wars, you can handle Kubernetes in production (Because that’s exactly what we did) - slides by @errordeveloper & @weaveworks - see also: k8s Anywhere

  • Fully Automatic Database: PosgresSQL - HA wit k8s - slides by @fuzzychef

  • Monitoring Microservices at scale - 3 ways that Kubernetes changes monitoring by @sysdig

  • Kubernetes in Production at the New York Times - slides by @ericandrewlewis (CoreOS on AWS)

  • Leveraging ephemeral namespaces in a CI/CD pipeline - by @canthefason - see: CI/CD evolution with #kubernetes namespaces && Key takeways

    --maximum-dead-containers=100
--maximum-dead-containers-per-container=2
--minimum-container-ttl-duration=1m0s

  • ChatOps: Small fails and big wins by @heim

Best practice for CI/CD on k8s seems to be: separate different applications and stages by using k8s namespaces and use ChatOps tools like Hubot (https://hubot.github.com) to provide fast feedback to the devs & ops.

  • Hypernetes - https://hyper.sh/ (Similar to ClearOS from intel?)

  • Container Wars continued? - http://kurma.io/ by @Apcera - slides

  • 1.2 milestones & Google Cloud Platform Podcast with Kelsey Hightower (starts at 06:20)

  • Apprenda Sales pitch? Hybrid Apps: Orchestrating Cloud Native and Traditional Application Architectures by @sschuller

  • A lightweight deployment system for «appops» - kubernauts/kploy

  • RedHat OpenShift: The Red Hat Ecosystem for Microservice and Container Development - tag: Kubernetes

Day 2

  • Pushing Kubernetes Forward

    • polvi/monokube by @polvi
    • etcd v3 (gRPC & HTTP/2) & API improvements for k8s use-case (see watch Key/Prefix & Rev options)
    • Multiple image formats in v1.3 API

  • Using Traffic control to Test Apps in Containers by @kinvolkio / @albcr - GitHub Repo - See kinvolk.io Blog post with video demonstration. Weave/Scope Viz1 Viz2 and tcd

  • Templatized Application configuration - Resources

    • Openshift Templates
    • Kubernetes Templates (Proposal)
    • Kubernetes Secret Generation
    • Helm (to merge with Deployment Manager?)
    • Deployment-Manager

  • If This Now What: Orchestrating an Enterprise - slides see also: Blog post - Kubernetes Pack by @DevoperandI

  • Interactive Monitoring for Kubernetes - slides by @tom_wilkie

  • Your App is alive - Slides from KubeCon & Slides from Colorado meetup (prior to kubecon) - simple Go server

  • Transforming the Government - notice: UKHomeOffice/vault-sidekick

  • Kubernetes Storage 101 - RedHat Storage corekube Volumes Deep dive

  • A Practical Guide to Container Scheduling by @tekgrrl

  • Making Sense of the Kubernetes community by @fintanr - Blog Post

  • Trading in the Kube Note: AdaptiveConsulting/ReactiveTraderCloud

Last updated: Tuesday, March 15

item.title: Kubernetes Workshop for Docker Saigon
item.author: vincent.drl@gmail.com (Vincent De Smet)
item.description:
This is the first draft of a guide I wrote to set up Kubernetes with CoreOS on DigitalOcean. This guide is battle-tested through a workshop for the Docker-Saigon Meetup Group. During the workshop, Users may use this draft to follow along with the instructions until the guide has been officially published on Digital Ocean.

Attendees need to have:

  • A laptop (Linux/OSX/Windows should all be fine)
  • A console ready to go with access to git & openssh
  • A Digital Ocean account ready (if you do not have an account, feel free to sign up with my referral link)
  • Decent Docker knowledge
  • Some CoreOS / Systemd knowledge

I estimate it takes about 3 hours to work through the guide.
